definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: The triumphant orchestration inthe forth movement concludes the symphony in absolute victory.
sentences.chinese: 第四樂章的成功編曲是交響曲在絕對勝利中結束。

sentences.english: Its orchestration is similar to that of Mahler's.
sentences.chinese: 其編曲方式與馬勒相似。

sentences.english: The orchestration in the second movement gives its pastoralsound.
sentences.chinese: 第二樂章的編曲又似一支牧歌。

sentences.english: He is also a composer and arranger.
sentences.chinese: 他還是作曲家和編曲者。

sentences.english: Its richness of orchestration lies between Beethoven and Mahler.
sentences.chinese: 其豐富的管絃樂編曲橫亙於貝多芬和馬勒之間。

definition: to compose a poem (to a given tune)
to supervise the manufacture of/to supervise the shooting of films/executive producer (film)
album/record (music)/special collection of printed or broadcast material
to compose a piece of music
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
Bes, a minor god of ancient Egypt
